alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Chatanika River Valley; Dalton Highway Summits; Delta Junction; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Fortymile Country; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; South Slopes Of The Central Brooks Range; South Slopes Of The Eastern Brooks Range; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Koyukuk Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River; Yukon Flats (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 2:27AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Prolonged Arctic Blast Late Weekend Into Early Next Week... A mid-winter arctic front is coming this weekend with seasonably cold temperatures lasting well into next week. While not particularly unusual, this will be one of the longer and more widespread cold snaps for the Interior this winter, as valley locations will fall to -30 F to -45 F (some cold spots will reach into the -50 F range) for overnight lows, with high temps struggling to warm much beyond -20 F early next week. This cold snap will last until at least Wednesday, with some slight moderation possible, but it may just drop right back into the deep freeze late next week again. In addition, higher terrain hills and Interior Mountains will see bitterly cold wind chills to -40 F or colder late Saturday into Sunday as the arctic front shifts south. Residents should prepare as needed for an old-fashioned Interior Alaska cold snap and have necessary cold weather gear available.
